alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 7:01PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Gulf, southwestern Liberty and northwestern Franklin Counties through 730 PM EDT/630 PM CDT/... At 700 PM EDT/600 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Wewahitchka, or 14 miles northeast of Port St. Joe, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Honeyville, Buck Siding, Sumatra, Howard Creek, Willis Landing, Beverly, Hays Place, Dalkeith and Fort Gadsden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT/700 PM CDT/ for Big Bend of and the Panhandle of Florida.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Franklin; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Liberty
